summary: This document is an index of records withheld in full by the Bureau of Prisons in response to a FOIA lawsuit by The New York Times. It lists 60 categories of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration, his apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, and his death by suicide on August 10, 2019, all withheld under various FOIA exemptions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) whose apparent suicide attempt and subsequent death are the subject of all withheld documents.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was involved in an incident at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) described as an 'apparent suicide attempt.' This generated numerous reports, photos, and investigative documents.

events.title: Epstein's Death by Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The event triggered a massive internal investigation, psychological reconstruction, and generated extensive records.

keyFacts: The Bureau of Prisons is withholding a vast trove of documents (over 60 categories) related to Epstein's incarceration and death in response to a FOIA lawsuit by The New York Times.
The withheld materials include an 'Incident Report' and 'Psychological Reconstruction' specifically regarding an 'apparent suicide attempt' by Epstein on July 23, 2019.
Documents related to Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, include a 'Psychological Reconstruction of Inmate Death,' investigative reports, photos, medical records, and over 1,100 internal emails.
The index reveals extensive record-keeping around Epstein's detention, including overtime logs, staff assignment rosters, inmate counts, suicide watch logs, and psychological observation logs.
FOIA exemptions cited for withholding include 7(A) (law enforcement), 5 (deliberative process), 6 & 7(C) (personal privacy), 7(E) (investigative techniques), and 7(F) (safety of individuals).
